itinerary.morning: Start your day with a visit to the historic district of Alfama. Wander through its narrow, winding streets, and soak in the traditional Portuguese culture. Visit the Lisbon Cathedral and the Castle of São Jorge for panoramic views of the city.
itinerary.lunch: Head to Time Out Market for a taste of Portuguese cuisine. Try local specialties like bacalhau (salted cod) and pastel de nata (custard tart).
itinerary.afternoon: Explore the cultural district of Belém. Visit the Belém Tower and the Jerónimos Monastery, both UNESCO World Heritage Sites. Don't miss the chance to try the famous Pastéis de Belém.
itinerary.evening: Enjoy a traditional Fado music performance in a cozy restaurant in Bairro Alto. Savor a dinner with typical Portuguese dishes like grilled sardines or octopus.

itinerary.morning: Begin with a peaceful visit to Kinkaku-ji, the Golden Pavilion, surrounded by beautiful gardens and reflections on the pond. Follow up with a stroll through Arashiyama Bamboo Grove for a unique natural experience.
itinerary.lunch: Experience Japanese cuisine at a local izakaya or soba noodle shop. Consider Yudofu Sagano for traditional tofu dishes and a serene environment.
itinerary.afternoon: Take a walking tour of the historic Gion district. Spot traditional machiya houses and, if you're lucky, a geisha or maiko. Visit the Kiyomizu-dera Temple for its stunning hillside views.
itinerary.evening: Enjoy kaiseki cuisine for dinner, a multi-course Japanese meal, to end your day on a cultural and culinary high note.

itinerary.morning: Start at the Jardin Majorelle, a tranquil garden and complex designed by French artist Jacques Majorelle. Nearby, visit the Yves Saint Laurent Museum to explore a collection of the designer's creations.
itinerary.lunch: Head to the medina for a traditional Moroccan meal. Try a tagine or couscous at a local riad with views of the bustling streets.
itinerary.afternoon: Explore the souks (markets) of Marrakech. Engage in some bargaining while shopping for textiles, spices, and crafts, and visit the historic Ben Youssef Madrasa.
itinerary.evening: Conclude your day at Jemaa el-Fnaa Square. Immerse yourself in the vibrant atmosphere with street performers, snake charmers, and food stalls offering local delights like harira soup and mint tea.
